item.title: Translating Teradata's MDIFF Function to Oracle SQL
item.description: Teradata defines its MDIFF function as follows: MDIFF Returns the moving difference between the specified value expression for the current row and the preceding width rows for each row in the partition. Here “the preceding width rows” means something like the preceding n rows, where n is sometimes interpreted as the sum of all of the preceding rows, but generally as the value of the last row. Teradata’s docs also has this to say about MDIFF:
